Pesan Jokowi ke Nadiem Makarim: Pendidikan Perlu Lompatan Besar
07 Nov 2019, 01:05 by Moh Khory Alfarizi, Yudono Yanuar
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Menteri Pendidikan dan Kebudayaan Nadiem Makarim menyatakan apa yang disampaikan Presiden Joko Widodo atau Jokowi kepada dirinya bahwa pendidikan di Indonesia perlu lompatan besar.
"Menurut Presiden Jokowi di pendidikan perlu adanya lompatan, kalau diam di tempat itu bahaya. Untuk mencapai lompatan itu pasti ada kegagalan, tapi kalau diam di tempat itu kegagalan sebenarnya. Jadi harus maju," ujar Nadiem dalam rapat kerja Kemdikbud dengan anggota DPR Komisi X di Komplek Senayan, Jakarta, Rabu, 6 November 2019.
Menurut Nadiem, Jokowi memintanya menjadi Mndikbud dengan alasan karena dirinya fokus dengan dua hal yaitu sumber daya manusia (SDM) dan inovasi. Nadiem sepakat dengan hal itu, karena meskipun dirinya berasal dari bidang teknologi, tapi fokus pada SDM, khususnya ketika mendirikan GoJek yang sudah berkembang sekarang.
SDM, kata Nadiem, harus mempunyai karakteristik sehingga akan menimbulkan ide-ide yang manarik. "Semuanya manusianya," katanya. "Ada adabtibility, flexibility, kemampuan kerja sama tim, dan kemampuan berkomunikasi."
Sehingga, Nadiem berujar, jika digabungkan akan menjadi manusia yang bisa menghadapi masa depan. "Saya meyakini perubahan akan semakin cepat. Jadi satu-satunya hal yang pasti adalah perubahan harus dipercepat," lanjut Nadiem.
Kemampuan dan kemauan belajar, Nadiem juga menjelaskan, adalah kompetensi terpenting dan memiliki karakter moralitas untuk terus memperbaikinya.

Jokowi's Message to Nadiem Makarim: Education Needs a Big Leap
Nov 7 2019, 01:05 by Moh Khory Alfarizi, Yudono Yanuar
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Minister of Education and Culture Nadiem Makarim stated what President Joko Widodo or Jokowi told him that education in Indonesia needed a big leap.
"According to President Jokowi in education there needs to be a leap, if staying in that place is dangerous. To achieve that jump there must be a failure, but if staying in that place is a real failure. So we must move forward," Nadiem said in a Ministry of Education and Culture meeting with members of the House of Representatives Commission X at the Senayan Complex, Jakarta, Wednesday, November 6, 2019.
According to Nadiem, Jokowi asked him to become the Minister of Education and Culture on the grounds because he focused on two things namely human resources (HR) and innovation. Nadiem agreed with that, because even though he came from the technology field, he focused on human resources, especially when he founded GoJek, which has been developed now.
HR, said Nadiem, must have characteristics that will lead to interesting ideas. "Everything is human," he said. "There is adabtibility, flexibility, the ability of teamwork, and the ability to communicate."
So, Nadiem said, if combined they would become humans who could face the future. "I believe that change will accelerate. So the only thing that is certain is that change must be accelerated," Nadiem continued.
The ability and willingness to learn, Nadiem also explained, is the most important competency and has the character of morality to continue to improve it.
